translation.en: Vision, normal.
Hearing, normal.
Smell… [sniffs]
…normal.
Pain perception, normal.
Blood glucose, electrolytes, enzymes, all abnormally normal.
translation.ko: 혈당, 전해질, 효소 모두 비정상적으로 정상

translation.en: Just what you'd expect from a brand-new body.
Emotional responses and stress tolerance, normal.
Memories, clear.
I am human.
Morning, Nina.
Hi, Mack.
Would you please come to the medical room?
For the physical?
Just give me a moment to take all this in.
I was just born into this world, you know.
The printing is accurate, right down to the patterns in the iris.
Even twins don't match that well.
Mmm. My taste buds seem to be working fine too.
Although this stuff may not look all that appetizing,
it's not bad.
When I eat it, I can tell that it tastes good.
We're instinctively comparing it to food we ate in the past.
translation.ko: 과거에 먹은 음식과 본능적으로 비교하는 거예요

translation.en: What about your memories? How's the connection?
When I was getting backed up, I lay down on the bed and closed my eyes.
translation.ko: 정보를 백업할 때 침대에 누워 눈을 감았어요

translation.en: And then when I opened them again, I was on the other side of space.
translation.ko: 그리고 다시 눈을 떴더니 우주 반대편에 와 있더군요

translation.en: It's kind of a shock.
[Mack] Same here.
I have the illusion of my consciousness just continuing right from that day.
translation.ko: 그날 이후로 의식이 계속 이어진다는 착각을 하고 있죠

translation.en: But the physical person I am now, it's--
It's not the person who got their memory backed up.
Oscar's finished printing.
Amazing.
The cavity's gone. This new body's fantastic.
Yes!
Hey, I think it's about time we got to work.
We can, after everybody's printed.
[Mack] We need to get going before the migrant vessel gets here.
translation.ko: 이민선이 도착하기 전에 일을 시작해야 해요

translation.en: [chuckles] Bullshit.
The migrants won't arrive for another hundred years.
Living beings can't make it through subspace, even in cryosleep.
translation.ko: 냉동 수면 상태라도 아공간을 버틸 순 없어요

translation.en: They can't warp here.
Damn it.
-[Mack] Hello, Patty. -[Oscar] Hey, Patty.
Good morning, everyone.
[Mack] While we're waiting for Lewis, let's talk.
We're almost at our destination of Planet X-10.
translation.ko: 목적지인 엑스-10 행성에 거의 다 왔어요

translation.en: We've already entered its star system.
How many days has it been since we left Earth?
It's been what, a week?
But of course, that's in days based on the rotation of the Earth.
So where are our original selves now?
We can't track them in real time.
But if we were to make a rough estimate…
the migrant vessel should be around here.
It's a long trip, so everyone's in cryosleep
to keep from aging.
Our original selves are dreaming away.
It must be strange for them too.
Another version of their self has been created
on the other side of space and is working while they're asleep.
translation.ko: 자신들이 자는 동안 우주 반대편에서 일한다니

translation.en: We were chosen and given special permission
to be printed by The Womb.
It's an honor.
We were selected because we were the most qualified.
So we have to make Planet X-10 a comfortable place to live
before they arrive.
-[alert blaring] -What's happening?
Shit! It's an electromagnetic wave. And it's damn strong.
It can't be.
It's a flare.
[sighs] Had me going for a second.
No reports of fire.
But there are some areas I can't confirm.
Looks like some of the electronic equipment isn't responding.
All right, let's split up and inspect for damage.
-Got it? -[all] Got it.
[Patty] Good it didn't happen while you were out there.
translation.ko: 밖에 있을 때 그런 게 아니라 다행이에요

translation.en: Could have been exposed to radiation.
Luck was on my side.
I want to know why nobody told us that this sun sneezes.
translation.ko: 기침하는 태양이란 걸 왜 안 알려 줬을까요

translation.en: [Patty] Yeah, that was a little too close for comfort, if you ask me.
It's just a little bit of bad luck.
Wow. It's huge.
[Patty] What is it, Mack?
[Mack] The atmospheric transformer.
[chuckles] It'd better be big.
That thing is gonna give the entire planet a makeover.
[Mack] Yeah.
Technically, the plants will do most of the work.
But we need the reactor to stabilize the atmosphere first.
translation.ko: 리액터가 대기를 먼저 안정시켜야 하긴 해요

translation.en: Can anyone tell what's going on with the printing room?
The Womb should've finished printing Lewis by now,
but he hasn't come out.
[Oscar] Hold on. The Womb is currently in operation.
That's odd.
There's an error message.
[Nina] I'd like to take a look inside,
but entry during printing is a violation of privacy.
Is everyone okay with me going in?
-[Oscar] Of course. -[Mack] Permission granted.
[Patty] I agree as well.
What is this?
What's wrong?
-[Nina panting] It's Lewis, he… -[Mack] Nina?
[Nina] Get over here! Come quickly!
[Patty gasps] Oh, my God!
Thank you.
Feeling better?
[sighs] I guess so.
The DNA analysis shows this is definitely Lewis.
translation.ko: 유전자 분석 결과를 보면 루이스가 맞아요

translation.en: But it is clearly not. Just look at him.
There has to have been an error during the printing.
It must have been from the flare.
Maybe it caused a surge in The Womb that led to a malfunction.
[Mack] So, is he alive?
The heart is beating.
[Mack] Any brain activity?
Yes, but only weak activity.
It's a state known as an alpha coma.
[Mack] Have there been other cases of The Womb failing during a printing?
translation.ko: 자궁이 출력 중에 오작동한 경우가 있었나요?

translation.en: [Nina] None that have been made public.
There may have been during the development phase.
Remember, it wasn't made by human hands.
[Mack] When dealing with printing errors,
those who are at the scene decide what course of action to take, correct?
translation.ko: 현장에 있는 사람들이 대처 방안을 결정하는 거죠?

translation.en: Yes, that's right.
[Mack] We should reprint a proper Lewis.
It's for the good of the mission.
We should dispose of this one.
But that would be murder, wouldn't it?
Do we have the right to take his life just because he lacks consciousness?
translation.ko: 의식 불명을 이유로 목숨을 빼앗을 권리가 있어요?

translation.en: He's still a living being.
Patty, we need material that contains Lewis's genetic information
translation.ko: 패티, 루이스의 유전 정보가 담긴 물질이 있어야

translation.en: in order to reprint him.
The quickest way to do that is to disassemble this one
translation.ko: 저걸 분해해서 생체 재료로 쓰는 게

translation.en: and use it as biomaterial.
And it can't be from just anyone.
To create Lewis, we need Lewis's biomaterial.
translation.ko: 루이스를 만들려면 루이스의 생체 재료가 필요해요

translation.en: We can make more by cultivating. The bodies that we have now were made
by growing material from harvested cells, right?
I did go ahead and start the cell cultivation,
just in case.
But it's going to take a while.
[Mack] If we wait, our schedule will be delayed.
Lewis is responsible for the atmospheric transformer.
We should destroy this one and print a new, proper Lewis immediately.
translation.ko: 이건 파기하고 정상적인 루이스를 즉시 새로 출력해야 해요

translation.en: Look, I agree with Mack.
If I were in that state, I wouldn't want to be kept alive.
translation.ko: 내가 저 상태라면 살기 싫을 거예요

translation.en: You're just trying to detract from the fact that it's murder.
That is not a person. It's just a lump of flesh.
[sighs] Patty…
According to the rules set forth by the Planetary Development Agency,
major decisions require unanimous consent.
If you aren't in agreement, we can't euthanize him.
translation.ko: 당신이 반대하면 안락사는 할 수 없어요

translation.en: We can put it in the record that you initially objected,
so it won't be on your conscience.
[Oscar] We respect your principles, Patty, we do.
And all life should be protected, without exception.
translation.ko: 모든 생명은 보호받아야 하죠 예외 없이요

translation.en: But we're in a special situation.
That's not it at all.
[Nina] I can take care of the procedure.
He'll just go into a deep sleep, without ever knowing he was even born.
translation.ko: 태어났다는 사실도 모른 채 깊이 잠들 거예요

translation.en: Okay, if there's no other choice.
It just doesn't seem right to let a soul be destroyed.
[Oscar] A soul, huh?
Do we even have souls?
Beats me.
Seriously, though, are all botanists like her?
[Oscar] I think she might be especially compassionate.
She says she can even talk to cats and dogs.
Well, having a botanist is essential for this mission.
If there aren't plants rooted into the surface of Planet X-10,
there'll be no stable supply of oxygen.
Yeah, sure, but… [scoffs] …this isn't normal.
I'm not talking about her. I mean all of us.
We asked her to agree to kill one of our own.
translation.ko: 우리 중 한 명을 죽이는 데 동의하라고 했어요

translation.en: That's not on us.
Blame whoever thought of printing human beings
in the first place.
You know living things can't travel through subspace.
This was our only choice.
Hi, Nina. How are you feeling?
Have you seen Planet X-10 yet?
I am the original version of you.
I recorded this right before leaving Earth.
I left a present for you. I hope you found it.
If you, the printed version of me,
properly share the same consciousness and memories of the past,
then you should know what it is.
It's the cat doll from our childhood. [chuckles]
It's always been by my side, watching over me,
and-- and now I'm giving it to you.
[chuckles] She's thinking of me
so that, as a printed copy, I don't forget that I'm human.
[on screen] So, I guess I'll see you in a hundred years.
By that time, a green paradise will have spread out
translation.ko: 그때에는 푸른 천국이 엑스-10 행성 위를

translation.en: over the surface of Planet X-10.
This smell really takes me back to Earth.
translation.ko: 인형 냄새를 맡으니 지구로 돌아간 듯해

translation.en: The wind, the sun…
[chuckles] …the swing that was in my backyard.
[Mack] It's going to take three syringes?
The first is a sedative, the next is a muscle relaxant,
translation.ko: 첫 번째는 안정제 다음은 근육 이완제

translation.en: and the last one stops the heart from beating.
A sedative?
[Nina] It's the most humane process.
Is Patty there with you?
No. She's in the Greenhouse.
[Oscar] She doesn't wanna see this.
[Nina] Okay, I guess I should get started.
[Mack] Please.
You shouldn't feel a thing.
You'll just start sleeping a little deeper than you are now.
translation.ko: 그냥 지금보다 더 깊게 잠드는 거예요

translation.en: You're going to be reborn.
Your being here was a mistake.
Wait.
What?
Never mind. Must be imagining things.
Good night.
Sleep peacefully.
-Nina! -Damn it!
[Oscar] Patty! Patty! C-Can you hear me?
Oscar, what's wrong?
[Oscar] Stay where you are.
Why? What's happening?
[Oscar] It's-- It's Lewis. He got up, and--
-[alert blaring] -[automated voice] Fire! Fire!
All crew members, please evacuate immediately.
-[Mack, Oscar shuddering] -Fire! Fire! Fire! Fire!
Oscar, help Nina. [panting]
[automated voice] Fire! Fire!
-All crew members, please evacuate… -Can anyone hear me?
translation.ko: - 모든 선원은 즉시… - 누구 내 말 들려요?

translation.en: -This is Patty. Please respond. What ha-- -[objects crash]
[gasps] Lewis?
Patty! Run!
Nina! Are you all right? Nina.
Oh, no. Oh, no.
[Mack] Lewis?
Lewis! [grunts]
I-- I feel like we should say something.
translation.ko: 무슨 말이라도 해야 할 것 같아요

translation.en: You go ahead. I don't have any words.
Goodbye, Nina.
I-- I'm sorry.
Now it's more like "The Tomb" than The Womb.
Those words are more connected than you might think.
They say, long ago, that people built graves and temples
as wombs for the dead to be reborn in.
Don't tell me you're gonna use that for self-defense.
No, for hunting.
You know the printer won't let us make weapons.
This is as good as it gets.
It's too dangerous to leave out there.
[Oscar] The reprint is starting. We'll see Nina in half an hour.
[Nina] Vision, normal.
Hearing, normal.
Smell… [sniffs]
…normal.
Pain perception, normal.
Memories, clear.
I am human.
